subject: Re: How to get test's name in JUnit 4
msgSnippet: ... Hm, I think my terminology is wrong? Doesn t that give you the class s name, not the test s name? I need the... name of the method currently being executed
messageBody:
> > In JUnit 4, since you don't subclass TestCase, how do you
> > access the test's name?
>
> test.getClass().getName() ? Look at the call stack?
>

Hm, I think my terminology is wrong? Doesn't that give you the class's
name, not the test's name?

I need the... name of the method currently being executed that is
annotated with the @Test annotation. Obtaining that name would ideally
be accessible from both the @Before method as well as the actual @Test
method, as seen in the below example, but I can probably just move the
generic code into each test case where the method's name matters.

i.e.

public class Example {
String testName;

@Before
public void init() {
// grab the current test's
// name (i.e. "testSomething", not
// "Example"), modify it in some
// uniform way.
testName = ??
}

@Test
public void testSomething() {
// use testName, and grab the test's (unmodified) name
// and modify it in some test-specific way
}
}
